Context: In this study, we show that STING / mice presented defective protective mechanisms of intestinal mucosa, including decreased number of goblet cells, diminished mucus production, and lower levels of secretory IgA, when compared with wild-type (WT) mice.
Small intestine and colon of wild-type (WT) and STING / mice were collected for analyses of (a) villi height, (c) crypt height, and (e) the number of goblet cells per crypt.
